purpose: Define the limits and approved use of predictive logic within governance pathways.

principles.supportOnly: Predictive outputs may inform decisions but cannot override core governance rules.
principles.noAutonomy: Predictive engines may not apply changes to system state directly.
principles.explainability: Predictive outputs must include a clear explanation of their basis.
principles.auditability: All predictive decisions must be logged before use.

approvedUses.loadForecasting: Predict expected system load to optimise engine scheduling.
approvedUses.riskAssessment: Estimate risk levels based on prior anomalies.
approvedUses.behaviourPrediction: Predict next behaviour state for safety assessments.
approvedUses.optimisationSupport: Provide non-mandatory suggestions to optimisation engine.

prohibitedUses.modeChanges: Predictive logic may not trigger mode transitions.
prohibitedUses.sealDecisions: Predictive logic cannot influence seal validation.
prohibitedUses.manifestDecisions: Predictive logic cannot declare manifests valid or invalid.
prohibitedUses.runtimeOverrides: Predictive outputs cannot override runtime restrictions.

validation.failureAction: Discard predictive output and write audit entry.

summary.statement: These rules ensure predictive engines support governance without overriding core integrity or system policy.
